text:
I only have one frame so far. Please share the remaining keyframes if you want a full frame‑by‑frame description. Based on this first frame:

Frame 1
- State: Wrist‑camera view of the workspace. A plastic multi‑drawer unit is on the right, the gripper is far from the drawers, and there’s no contact with any object.
- Action: Navigation/positioning to a broad overview or pre‑grasp vantage; no manipulation executed yet.

Strategy assessment
- Too early to judge compliance or failure. No grasp/interaction attempts are visible.

What to do next (high level)
- Perceive and localize the target drawer handle: segment the drawer face, detect handle pose.
- Move to a pre‑grasp pose aligned with the handle’s approach vector.
- Open gripper, approach in a straight line, close on the handle, and pull with controlled force.
- If the goal is a different drawer or a push action, adjust approach accordingly.
- Provide the subsequent frames so I can verify whether the actions follow the planned strategy or if a failure mode (misalignment, premature contact, occlusion, slip) has occurred.
